intro: Tarenna coriacea, commonly known as the rough tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when mature. Tarenna coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
